title.value: EiG-Search: Generating Edge-Induced Subgraphs for GNN Explanation in Linear Time
title.justification: The paper's title is clearly stated at the beginning of the document and is consistent throughout the paper.
title.quote: EiG-Search: Generating Edge-Induced Subgraphs for GNN Explanation in Linear Time

extractions.description: This paper introduces EiG-Search, a method aimed at enhancing the explainability of Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) by generating subgraph-level explanations through edge-induced subgraphs. The method is training-free, utilizes a linear-time search algorithm to find key subgraph structures, and demonstrates efficiency and superior performance across multiple datasets compared to existing methods.

type.justification: The paper includes extensive experiments and evaluations to demonstrate the performance and efficiency of the proposed EiG-Search method over seven datasets, highlighting its empirical nature.
type.quote: We conduct extensive experiments on a total of seven datasets, demonstrating its superior performance and efficiency both quantitatively and qualitatively over the leading baselines.

name.justification: The research is primarily focused on improving the explainability of Graph Neural Networks through subgraph-level explanations.
name.quote: Understanding and explaining the predictions of Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) is crucial for enhancing their safety and trustworthiness.

name.justification: The paper lies within the broader area of making AI systems more interpretable and transparent, here particularly focusing on GNNs.
name.quote: The explainability of Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) has become a crucial topic, driven by their “black box” nature and the demand for transparency in sensitive fields.

name.justification: The specific subfield of deep learning concerning neural networks designed to operate on graph-structured data.
name.quote: A graph neural network could be written as φ(A, X) → Y, which maps a graph to a probability distribution over a set of classes denoted by Y.

name.justification: EiG-Search is introduced as a novel method in the paper for generating subgraph-level explanations for GNNs.
name.quote: Building upon these considerations, we introduce a training-free approach, named EiG-Search.

is_contributed.justification: The paper's main contribution is the development of the EiG-Search model for explaining GNNs.
is_contributed.quote: Building upon these considerations, we introduce a training-free approach, named EiG-Search.

is_executed.justification: EiG-Search method is evaluated through experiments, indicating execution in the study.
is_executed.quote: We conduct extensive experiments on a total of seven datasets, demonstrating its superior performance and efficiency.

is_compared.justification: The performance of EiG-Search is compared with existing methods in terms of efficiency and explanation quality.
is_compared.quote: We compare our approach with a range of leading subgraph-level GNN explanation methods.

referenced_paper_title.value: EiG-Search: Generating Edge-Induced Subgraphs for GNN Explanation in Linear Time
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper itself is the primary reference for the EiG-Search model as it is the proposed method of the study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: This paper focuses on generating intuitive subgraph explanations... we introduce a training-free approach, named EiG-Search.
